meanings.definition: The action of making or declaring something sacred.
meanings.sent1: The consecration of the church was a solemn ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The consecration of the temple brought a sense of peace to the community.
meanings.sent3: During the consecration of the new park, the mayor accidentally tripped over a rock.
meanings.sent4: The consecration of their friendship was sealed with a heartfelt embrace.
meanings.sent5: The consecration of the ancient artifact was shrouded in mystery and reverence.

meanings.definition: The act of dedicating oneself to a particular purpose or goal.
meanings.sent1: Her consecration to her studies paid off with top grades.
meanings.sent2: His consecration to his craft led to a successful career as an artist.
meanings.sent3: In a moment of consecration, she vowed to always pursue her dreams.
meanings.sent4: The consecration to their cause united them in a common mission.
meanings.sent5: His consecration to fitness transformed his health and well-being.
